docs.lead_paragraph: One way of dealing with the federal deadlock is to have older, healthy Americans work a little longer.

headline.seo: The Payoff in Retiring a Few Years Later

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column asserts that one way of dealing with federal budget deadlock is to raise retirement age.

docs.lead_paragraph:
John Flores was the one who spotted the spot. “Somebody painted red on the blue door,” he said.
 
John, a 14-year-old ninth grader, had a paint brush and a mission: to bring a bright new color scheme to his school, the Bronx Design and Construction Academy on East 151st Street in the Melrose section of the South Bronx. And the color on his brush was “Rocky Mountain sky,” an arresting color that blended easily with a palette created by the renowned designer Massimo Vignelli.

headline.main: Custom Colors for School, New Purpose for Students

docs.abstract: City Room blog; Publicolor, nonprofit group that has spruced up schools, homeless shelters and other community buildings in New York City since 1990s, asks designer Massimo Vignello to create specially designed colors for Bronx Design and Construction Academy; hope is colors will encourage students to graduate and go on to college. Photos (M)

headline.print_headline: Custom Colors for School, New Purpose for Students

docs.abstract: The renowned designer Massimo Vignelli created a palette for a Bronx school as part of a nonprofit organization’s project to give the walls a new look and improve students’ chances of graduating on time and going on to college.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.main: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions
headline.print_headline: Lax Policing of Doctor and Pharmacy Conflicts Is Found in Medicare Coverage Decisions

docs.abstract: Report from Health and Human Services inspector general Daniel R Levinson says Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services has not clearly defined 'conflict of interest' among doctors and pharmacists and does not enforce standards meant to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions.
docs.snippet: The federal Medicare agency had not clearly defined “conflict of interest” and did not enforce standards to prevent such conflicts from influencing coverage decisions, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Texans Rebut Gov. Rick Perry After Rejection of Medicaid Expansion
headline.main: Texans Rebut Gov. Rick Perry on Expansion of Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Texans Rebut Governor On Expansion Of Medicaid

docs.abstract: Hundreds of activists and uninsured Texans plan to rally at steps of State Capitol, increasing pressure on Gov Rick Perry and other Republican leaders to change their refusal to expand medicaid, major provision of Pres Obama's health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: Supporters said the expansion would provide coverage to more than one million low-income residents and ease the burden on local taxpayers.
